PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: C.L. Williams, 3629 Butler Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 18, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think that refuse drivers and collectors should be tipped at Christmas time? Is service affected if they are not?" answer reads: "No, because I work for a big concern, the Pennsylvania Railroad Co., and they don't give me tips.  The refuse collector is getting a salary, so he's only doing his job.  I think it affects the services because I've seen where garbage would linger around for quite some time.  Eventually, the refuse collector would come back.  This was where I lived before, on Auburn St.  However, where I live now, I get good service."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of C.L. Williams wearing striped cloak with barbershop poles, seated in barbershop with two toned walls, large fan, cash register that reads "Cash $5.00", and furniture with mirror and bottles on the left
